About this report

Report parameters

Contexts

No contexts were selected, so all contexts were included by default.

Sites

The following sites were included:

  • http://testphp.vulnweb.com

(If no sites were selected, all sites were included by default.)

An included site must also be within one of the included contexts for its data to be included in the report.

Risk levels

Included: 高等的, 中等的, 低, Informational

Excluded: None

Confidence levels

Included: User Confirmed, 高等的, 中等的, 低

Excluded: User Confirmed, 高等的, 中等的, 低, 假阳性

Alerts

  1. Risk=中等的, Confidence=中等的 (51)

    1. http://testphp.vulnweb.com (51)

      1. .htaccess Information Leak (7)
        1. GET http://testphp.vulnweb.com/Mod_Rewrite_Shop/.htaccess
          Alert tags
          • OWASP_2021_A05
          • WSTG-v42-CONF-05
          • OWASP_2017_A06
          Alert description

          htaccess files can be used to alter the configuration of the Apache Web Server software to enable/disable additional functionality and features that the Apache Web Server software has to offer.

          Request
          Request line and header section (288 bytes) 
          GET http://testphp.vulnweb.com/Mod_Rewrite_Shop/.htaccess HTTP/1.1
Host: testphp.vulnweb.com
User-Agent: Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 10.0; Win64; x64; rv:92.0) Gecko/20100101 Firefox/92.0
Pragma: no-cache
Cache-Control: no-cache
Referer: http://testphp.vulnweb.com
Content-Length: 0
          Request body (0 bytes)
          Response
          Status line and header section (252 bytes) 
          HTTP/1.1 200 OK
Server: nginx/1.19.0
Date: Mon, 25 Jul 2022 13:42:09 GMT
Content-Type: application/octet-stream
Content-Length: 176
Last-Modified: Wed, 15 Feb 2012 10:32:40 GMT
Connection: keep-alive
ETag: "4f3b89c8-b0"
Accept-Ranges: bytes
          Response body (176 bytes) 
          RewriteEngine on
RewriteRule Details/.*/(.*?)/ details.php?id=$1 [L]
RewriteRule BuyProduct-(.*?)/ buy.php?id=$1 [L]
RewriteRule RateProduct-(.*?)\.html rate.php?id=$1 [L]
          Evidence 
          HTTP/1.1 200 OK
          Solution

          Ensure the .htaccess file is not accessible.
        2. GET http://testphp.vulnweb.com/Mod_Rewrite_Shop/BuyProduct-1/.htaccess

<div style="background-color:lightgray;width:100%;text-align:center;font-size:12px;padding:1px">
<p style="padding-left:5%;padding-right:5%"><b>Warning</b>: This is not a real shop. This is an example PHP application, which is intentionally vulnerable to web attacks. It is intended to help you test Acunetix. It also helps you understand how developer errors and bad configuration may let someone break into your website. You can use it to test other tools and your manual hacking skills as well. Tip: Look for potential SQL Injections, Cross-site Scripting (XSS), and Cross-site Request Forgery (CSRF), and more.</p>
</div>

<!-- InstanceEnd --></html>
          Parameter 
          X-Frame-Options
          Solution

          Most modern Web browsers support the X-Frame-Options HTTP header. Ensure it's set on all web pages returned by your site (if you expect the page to be framed only by pages on your server (e.g. it's part of a FRAMESET) then you'll want to use SAMEORIGIN, otherwise if you never expect the page to be framed, you should use DENY. Alternatively consider implementing Content Security Policy's "frame-ancestors" directive.

        2. GET http://testphp.vulnweb.com/AJAX/index.php
          Alert tags
          • OWASP_2021_A05
          • WSTG-v42-CLNT-09
          • OWASP_2017_A06
          Alert description

          X-Frame-Options header is not included in the HTTP response to protect against 'ClickJacking' attacks.
          Request
          Request line and header section (257 bytes) 
          GET http://testphp.vulnweb.com/AJAX/index.php HTTP/1.1
Host: testphp.vulnweb.com
User-Agent: Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 10.0; Win64; x64; rv:92.0) Gecko/20100101 Firefox/92.0
Pragma: no-cache
Cache-Control: no-cache
Referer: http://testphp.vulnweb.com
          Request body (0 bytes)
          Response
          Status line and header section (200 bytes) 
          HTTP/1.1 200 OK
Server: nginx/1.19.0
Date: Mon, 25 Jul 2022 13:37:41 GMT
Content-Type: text/html; charset=UTF-8
Connection: keep-alive
X-Powered-By: PHP/5.6.40-38+ubuntu20.04.1+deb.sury.org+1
          Response body (4236 bytes) 
          <!DOCTYPE html PUBLIC "-//W3C//DTD XHTML 1.0 Transitional//EN" "http://www.w3.org/TR/xhtml1/DTD/xhtml1-transitional.dtd">
<html xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml">
<head>
<meta http-equiv="Content-Type" content="text/html; charset=iso-8859-1" />
<title>ajax test</title>
<link href="styles.css" rel="stylesheet" type="text/css" />
<script type="text/javascript">
	var httpreq = null;	

	function SetContent(XML) {
		var items = XML.getElementsByTagName('items').item(0).getElementsByTagName('item');
		var inner = '<ul>';
		for(i=0; i<items.length; i++){
			inner = inner + '<li><a href="javascript:getInfo(\'' + items[i].attributes.item(0).value + '\', \'' + items[i].attributes.item(1).value + '\')">' + items[i].firstChild.nodeValue + '</a></li>';
		}
		
		inner = inner + '</ul>'
		
		cd = document.getElementById('contentDiv');
		cd.innerHTML = inner;
		
		id = document.getElementById('infoDiv');
		id.innerHTML = '';
	}

	function httpCompleted() {
		if (httpreq.readyState==4 && httpreq.status==200) {						
			SetContent(httpreq.responseXML);
			httpreq = null;
		}		
	}
	
	function SetInfo(XML) {
		var ii = XML.getElementsByTagName('iteminfo').item(0);
		var inner = '';
		
		inner = inner + '<p><strong>' + ii.getElementsByTagName('name').item(0).firstChild.nodeValue + '</strong></p>';
		
		pict  = ii.getElementsByTagName('picture');
		if(pict.length>0){
			inner = inner + '<img src="../showimage.php?file=' + pict.item(0).firstChild.nodeValue + '"/>';
		}
		
		descs = ii.getElementsByTagName('description');
		for (i=0; i<descs.length; i++){
			inner = inner + '<p>' + descs.item(i).firstChild.nodeValue + '</p>';
		}
		
		id = document.getElementById('infoDiv');
		id.innerHTML = inner;
	}
	
	function httpInfoCompleted() {		
		if (httpreq.readyState==4 && httpreq.status==200) {
			SetInfo(httpreq.responseXML);
			httpreq = null;
		}		
	}
	
	function loadSomething(what) {			
		getHttpRequest();		
		httpreq.open('GET', what, true);		
		httpreq.send('');
	}
	
	function getInfo(where, which) {
		getHttpRequest();		
		httpreq.onreadystatechange = httpInfoCompleted;
		if (where=='infotitle'){
			httpreq.open('POST', where+'.php', true);
			httpreq.setRequestHeader('content-type', 'application/x-www-form-urlencoded');
			httpreq.send('id='+which);
		}
		else {
			httpreq.open('GET', where+'.php?id='+which, true);
			httpreq.send('');
		}
	}
	
	function xmlCompleted () {
		if (httpreq.readyState==4 && httpreq.status==200) {
			xd = document.getElementById('xmlDiv');
			xd.innerHTML = httpreq.responseText;
			httpreq = null;
		}	
	}
	
	function sendXML () {
		getHttpRequest();
		httpreq.onreadystatechange = xmlCompleted;
		httpreq.open('POST', 'showxml.php');
		httpreq.setRequestHeader('content-type', 'text/xml');
		httpreq.send('<xml><node name="nodename1">nodetext1</node><node name="nodename2">nodetext2</node></xml>');
	}
	
	function getHttpRequest() {
		// free the curent one
		if (httpreq!=null){
			httpreq.abort();
			httpreq = null;
		}		

    if( window.XMLHttpRequest ) {
			httpreq = new XMLHttpRequest();
			if (httpreq.overrideMimeType) {
					httpreq.overrideMimeType('text/xml');
			}
    } else if(ActiveXObject) {
     	httpreq = new ActiveXObject("Msxml2.XMLHTTP");
		}
			httpreq.onreadystatechange = httpCompleted;
	}
	
	function SetMyCookie() {
		document.cookie = "mycookie=3";
		alert('A cookie was set by JavaScript.');
	}
</script>
</head>
<body>
<table border="0" cellpadding="3" width="500" align="center">
  <tr>
    <td class="bordered">
			<a href="javascript:loadSomething('artists.php');">artists</a> |
			<a href="javascript:loadSomething('categories.php');">categories</a> | 
			<a href="#" onclick="loadSomething('titles.php')">titles</a> |
			<a href="#" onclick="sendXML()">send xml</a> |
			<a href="#" onclick="SetMyCookie()">setcookie</a>
		</td>
  </tr>
  <tr>
    <td>
			<div id="contentDiv">
				&nbsp;
			</div>
		</td>
  </tr>
	<tr>
    <td>
			<div id="infoDiv">
				&nbsp;
			</div>
		</td>
  </tr>
	
	<tr>
    <td>
			<div id="xmlDiv">
				&nbsp;
			</div>
		</td>
  </tr>
</table>
</body>
</html>
          Parameter 
          X-Frame-Options
          Solution

          Most modern Web browsers support the X-Frame-Options HTTP header. Ensure it's set on all web pages returned by your site (if you expect the page to be framed only by pages on your server (e.g. it's part of a FRAMESET) then you'll want to use SAMEORIGIN, otherwise if you never expect the page to be framed, you should use DENY. Alternatively consider implementing Content Security Policy's "frame-ancestors" directive.

        3. GET http://testphp.vulnweb.com/artists.php
          Alert tags
          • OWASP_2021_A05
          • WSTG-v42-CLNT-09
          • OWASP_2017_A06
          Alert description

          X-Frame-Options header is not included in the HTTP response to protect against 'ClickJacking' attacks.
          Request
          Request line and header section (254 bytes) 
          GET http://testphp.vulnweb.com/artists.php HTTP/1.1
Host: testphp.vulnweb.com
User-Agent: Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 10.0; Win64; x64; rv:92.0) Gecko/20100101 Firefox/92.0
Pragma: no-cache
Cache-Control: no-cache
Referer: http://testphp.vulnweb.com
          Request body (0 bytes)
          Response
          Status line and header section (200 bytes) 
          HTTP/1.1 200 OK
Server: nginx/1.19.0
Date: Mon, 25 Jul 2022 13:37:41 GMT
Content-Type: text/html; charset=UTF-8
Connection: keep-alive
X-Powered-By: PHP/5.6.40-38+ubuntu20.04.1+deb.sury.org+1
          Response body (5328 bytes) 
          <!DOCTYPE HTML PUBLIC "-//W3C//DTD HTML 4.01 Transitional//EN"
"http://www.w3.org/TR/html4/loose.dtd">

          Parameter 
          X-Frame-Options
          Solution

          Most modern Web browsers support the X-Frame-Options HTTP header. Ensure it's set on all web pages returned by your site (if you expect the page to be framed only by pages on your server (e.g. it's part of a FRAMESET) then you'll want to use SAMEORIGIN, otherwise if you never expect the page to be framed, you should use DENY. Alternatively consider implementing Content Security Policy's "frame-ancestors" directive.

	<h2 id='pageName'>artist: r4w8173</h2><div class='story'><p><p>
Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet, consectetuer adipiscing elit. Donec molestie.
    Sed aliquam sem ut arcu. Phasellus sollicitudin. Vestibulum condimentum facilisis
    nulla. In hac habitasse platea dictumst. Nulla nonummy. Cras quis libero.
    Cras venenatis. Aliquam posuere lobortis pede. Nullam fringilla urna id leo.
    Praesent aliquet pretium erat. Praesent non odio. Pellentesque a magna a
    mauris vulputate lacinia. Aenean viverra. Class aptent taciti sociosqu ad
    litora torquent per conubia nostra, per inceptos hymenaeos. Aliquam lacus.
    Mauris magna eros, semper a, tempor et, rutrum et, tortor.

          X-Frame-Options
          Solution

          Most modern Web browsers support the X-Frame-Options HTTP header. Ensure it's set on all web pages returned by your site (if you expect the page to be framed only by pages on your server (e.g. it's part of a FRAMESET) then you'll want to use SAMEORIGIN, otherwise if you never expect the page to be framed, you should use DENY. Alternatively consider implementing Content Security Policy's "frame-ancestors" directive.

Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet, consectetuer adipiscing elit. Donec molestie.
Sed aliquam sem ut arcu. Phasellus sollicitudin. Vestibulum condimentum facilisis
nulla. In hac habitasse platea dictumst. Nulla nonummy. Cras quis libero.
Cras venenatis. Aliquam posuere lobortis pede. Nullam fringilla urna id leo.

mauris vulputate lacinia. Aenean viverra. Class aptent taciti sociosqu ad
litora torquent per conubia nostra, per inceptos hymenaeos. Aliquam lacus.
Mauris magna eros, semper a, tempor et, rutrum et, tortor.
</p></p><p><a href='listproducts.php?artist=2'>view pictures of the artist</a></p><p><a href='#' onClick="window.open('./comment.php?aid=2','comment','width=500,height=400')">comment on this artist</a></p></div>	
</div>
<!-- InstanceEndEditable -->
<!--end content -->

<div style="background-color:lightgray;width:100%;text-align:center;font-size:12px;padding:1px">
<p style="padding-left:5%;padding-right:5%"><b>Warning</b>: This is not a real shop. This is an example PHP application, which is intentionally vulnerable to web attacks. It is intended to help you test Acunetix. It also helps you understand how developer errors and bad configuration may let someone break into your website. You can use it to test other tools and your manual hacking skills as well. Tip: Look for potential SQL Injections, Cross-site Scripting (XSS), and Cross-site Request Forgery (CSRF), and more.</p>
</div>
</div>
</body>
<!-- InstanceEnd --></html>
          Parameter 
          X-Frame-Options
          Solution

          Most modern Web browsers support the X-Frame-Options HTTP header. Ensure it's set on all web pages returned by your site (if you expect the page to be framed only by pages on your server (e.g. it's part of a FRAMESET) then you'll want to use SAMEORIGIN, otherwise if you never expect the page to be framed, you should use DENY. Alternatively consider implementing Content Security Policy's "frame-ancestors" directive.

        6. GET http://testphp.vulnweb.com/artists.php?artist=3
          Alert tags
          • OWASP_2021_A05
          • WSTG-v42-CLNT-09
          • OWASP_2017_A06
          Alert description

          X-Frame-Options header is not included in the HTTP response to protect against 'ClickJacking' attacks.
          Request
          Request line and header section (275 bytes) 
          GET http://testphp.vulnweb.com/artists.php?artist=3 HTTP/1.1
Host: testphp.vulnweb.com
User-Agent: Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 10.0; Win64; x64; rv:92.0) Gecko/20100101 Firefox/92.0
Pragma: no-cache
Cache-Control: no-cache
Referer: http://testphp.vulnweb.com/artists.php
          Request body (0 bytes)
          Response
          Status line and header section (200 bytes) 
          HTTP/1.1 200 OK
Server: nginx/1.19.0

Content-Type: text/html; charset=UTF-8
Connection: keep-alive
X-Powered-By: PHP/5.6.40-38+ubuntu20.04.1+deb.sury.org+1
          Response body (6193 bytes) 
          <!DOCTYPE HTML PUBLIC "-//W3C//DTD HTML 4.01 Transitional//EN"
"http://www.w3.org/TR/html4/loose.dtd">

          Parameter 
          X-Frame-Options
          Solution

          Most modern Web browsers support the X-Frame-Options HTTP header. Ensure it's set on all web pages returned by your site (if you expect the page to be framed only by pages on your server (e.g. it's part of a FRAMESET) then you'll want to use SAMEORIGIN, otherwise if you never expect the page to be framed, you should use DENY. Alternatively consider implementing Content Security Policy's "frame-ancestors" directive.

          Parameter 
          X-Frame-Options
          Solution

          Most modern Web browsers support the X-Frame-Options HTTP header. Ensure it's set on all web pages returned by your site (if you expect the page to be framed only by pages on your server (e.g. it's part of a FRAMESET) then you'll want to use SAMEORIGIN, otherwise if you never expect the page to be framed, you should use DENY. Alternatively consider implementing Content Security Policy's "frame-ancestors" directive.

  <div id="search">

      <label>search art</label> 
      <input name="searchFor" type="text" size="10"> 
      <input name="goButton" type="submit" value="go"> 
    </form> 
  </div>

      <li><a href="categories.php">Browse categories</a></li>

  Acunetix Ltd 
</div>

<div style="background-color:lightgray;width:100%;text-align:center;font-size:12px;padding:1px">
<p style="padding-left:5%;padding-right:5%"><b>Warning</b>: This is not a real shop. This is an example PHP application, which is intentionally vulnerable to web attacks. It is intended to help you test Acunetix. It also helps you understand how developer errors and bad configuration may let someone break into your website. You can use it to test other tools and your manual hacking skills as well. Tip: Look for potential SQL Injections, Cross-site Scripting (XSS), and Cross-site Request Forgery (CSRF), and more.</p>
</div>

</body>
<!-- InstanceEnd --></html>
          Parameter 
          X-Frame-Options
          Solution

          Most modern Web browsers support the X-Frame-Options HTTP header. Ensure it's set on all web pages returned by your site (if you expect the page to be framed only by pages on your server (e.g. it's part of a FRAMESET) then you'll want to use SAMEORIGIN, otherwise if you never expect the page to be framed, you should use DENY. Alternatively consider implementing Content Security Policy's "frame-ancestors" directive.

        9. GET http://testphp.vulnweb.com/disclaimer.php
          Alert tags
          • OWASP_2021_A05
          • WSTG-v42-CLNT-09
          • OWASP_2017_A06
          Alert description

          X-Frame-Options header is not included in the HTTP response to protect against 'ClickJacking' attacks.
          Request
          Request line and header section (257 bytes) 
          GET http://testphp.vulnweb.com/disclaimer.php HTTP/1.1
Host: testphp.vulnweb.com
User-Agent: Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 10.0; Win64; x64; rv:92.0) Gecko/20100101 Firefox/92.0
Pragma: no-cache
Cache-Control: no-cache
Referer: http://testphp.vulnweb.com
          Request body (0 bytes)
          Response
          Status line and header section (200 bytes) 
          HTTP/1.1 200 OK
Server: nginx/1.19.0
Date: Mon, 25 Jul 2022 13:37:41 GMT
Content-Type: text/html; charset=UTF-8
Connection: keep-alive
X-Powered-By: PHP/5.6.40-38+ubuntu20.04.1+deb.sury.org+1
          Response body (5524 bytes) 
          <!DOCTYPE HTML PUBLIC "-//W3C//DTD HTML 4.01 Transitional//EN"
"http://www.w3.org/TR/html4/loose.dtd">

<div id="content">
	<h2 id="pageName">Disclaimer</h2>
	  <div class="story">
		<h6>Please read carefully</h6>
		<p>This website is created to demonstrate the abilities of Acunetix new product <strong>WEB Vulnerability Scanner</strong>.</p>
		It is not intended to be a real online shop. Also this website was constructed with common web programming errors so it is buggy.
		<p>Please do not post any confidential information on this site. Do not give any creditcard number or real address, nor e-mail or
		website addresses.</p>
		<p>Information you post on this site are by no means private nor protected!</p>
		<p>All images on this site were generated with fre software <a href="http://www.eclectasy.com/Fractal-Explorer/index.html" target="_blank">
		<strong>Fractal Explorer</strong></a>.</p>
	  </div>

          Parameter 
          X-Frame-Options
          Solution

          Most modern Web browsers support the X-Frame-Options HTTP header. Ensure it's set on all web pages returned by your site (if you expect the page to be framed only by pages on your server (e.g. it's part of a FRAMESET) then you'll want to use SAMEORIGIN, otherwise if you never expect the page to be framed, you should use DENY. Alternatively consider implementing Content Security Policy's "frame-ancestors" directive.

          Parameter 
          X-Frame-Options
          Solution

          Most modern Web browsers support the X-Frame-Options HTTP header. Ensure it's set on all web pages returned by your site (if you expect the page to be framed only by pages on your server (e.g. it's part of a FRAMESET) then you'll want to use SAMEORIGIN, otherwise if you never expect the page to be framed, you should use DENY. Alternatively consider implementing Content Security Policy's "frame-ancestors" directive.

        11. GET http://testphp.vulnweb.com/hpp/
          Alert tags
          • OWASP_2021_A05
          • WSTG-v42-CLNT-09
          • OWASP_2017_A06
          Alert description

          X-Frame-Options header is not included in the HTTP response to protect against 'ClickJacking' attacks.
          Request
          Request line and header section (247 bytes) 
          GET http://testphp.vulnweb.com/hpp/ HTTP/1.1
Host: testphp.vulnweb.com
User-Agent: Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 10.0; Win64; x64; rv:92.0) Gecko/20100101 Firefox/92.0
Pragma: no-cache
Cache-Control: no-cache
Referer: http://testphp.vulnweb.com
          Request body (0 bytes)
          Response
          Status line and header section (200 bytes) 
          HTTP/1.1 200 OK
Server: nginx/1.19.0
Date: Mon, 25 Jul 2022 13:37:42 GMT
Content-Type: text/html; charset=UTF-8
Connection: keep-alive
X-Powered-By: PHP/5.6.40-38+ubuntu20.04.1+deb.sury.org+1
          Response body (203 bytes) 
          <title>HTTP Parameter Pollution Example</title>

<a href="?pp=12">check</a><br/>

<hr>
<a href='http://blog.mindedsecurity.com/2009/05/client-side-http-parameter-pollution.html'>Original article</a>
          Parameter 
          X-Frame-Options
          Solution

          Most modern Web browsers support the X-Frame-Options HTTP header. Ensure it's set on all web pages returned by your site (if you expect the page to be framed only by pages on your server (e.g. it's part of a FRAMESET) then you'll want to use SAMEORIGIN, otherwise if you never expect the page to be framed, you should use DENY. Alternatively consider implementing Content Security Policy's "frame-ancestors" directive.

        12. GET http://testphp.vulnweb.com/hpp/?pp=12
          Alert tags
          • OWASP_2021_A05
          • WSTG-v42-CLNT-09
          • OWASP_2017_A06
          Alert description

          X-Frame-Options header is not included in the HTTP response to protect against 'ClickJacking' attacks.
          Request
          Request line and header section (258 bytes) 
          GET http://testphp.vulnweb.com/hpp/?pp=12 HTTP/1.1
Host: testphp.vulnweb.com
User-Agent: Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 10.0; Win64; x64; rv:92.0) Gecko/20100101 Firefox/92.0
Pragma: no-cache
Cache-Control: no-cache
Referer: http://testphp.vulnweb.com/hpp/
          Request body (0 bytes)
          Response
          Status line and header section (200 bytes) 
          HTTP/1.1 200 OK
Server: nginx/1.19.0
Date: Mon, 25 Jul 2022 13:37:44 GMT
Content-Type: text/html; charset=UTF-8
Connection: keep-alive
X-Powered-By: PHP/5.6.40-38+ubuntu20.04.1+deb.sury.org+1
          Response body (383 bytes) 
          <title>HTTP Parameter Pollution Example</title>

<a href="?pp=12">check</a><br/>
<a href="params.php?p=valid&pp=12">link1</a><br/><a href="params.php?p=valid&pp=12">link2</a><br/><form action="params.php?p=valid&pp=12"><input type=submit name=aaaa/></form><br/>
<hr>
<a href='http://blog.mindedsecurity.com/2009/05/client-side-http-parameter-pollution.html'>Original article</a>
          Parameter 
          X-Frame-Options
          Solution

          Most modern Web browsers support the X-Frame-Options HTTP header. Ensure it's set on all web pages returned by your site (if you expect the page to be framed only by pages on your server (e.g. it's part of a FRAMESET) then you'll want to use SAMEORIGIN, otherwise if you never expect the page to be framed, you should use DENY. Alternatively consider implementing Content Security Policy's "frame-ancestors" directive.

        13. GET http://testphp.vulnweb.com/hpp/params.php?p=valid&pp=12
          Alert tags
          • OWASP_2021_A05
          • WSTG-v42-CLNT-09
          • OWASP_2017_A06
          Alert description

          X-Frame-Options header is not included in the HTTP response to protect against 'ClickJacking' attacks.
          Request
          Request line and header section (282 bytes) 
          GET http://testphp.vulnweb.com/hpp/params.php?p=valid&pp=12 HTTP/1.1

Pragma: no-cache
Cache-Control: no-cache
Referer: http://testphp.vulnweb.com/hpp/?pp=12

          Response
          Status line and header section (200 bytes) 
          HTTP/1.1 200 OK

X-Powered-By: PHP/5.6.40-38+ubuntu20.04.1+deb.sury.org+1
          Response body (7 bytes) 
          valid12
          Parameter 
          X-Frame-Options
          Solution

          Most modern Web browsers support the X-Frame-Options HTTP header. Ensure it's set on all web pages returned by your site (if you expect the page to be framed only by pages on your server (e.g. it's part of a FRAMESET) then you'll want to use SAMEORIGIN, otherwise if you never expect the page to be framed, you should use DENY. Alternatively consider implementing Content Security Policy's "frame-ancestors" directive.

        14. GET http://testphp.vulnweb.com/index.php
          Alert tags
          • OWASP_2021_A05
          • WSTG-v42-CLNT-09
          • OWASP_2017_A06
          Alert description

          X-Frame-Options header is not included in the HTTP response to protect against 'ClickJacking' attacks.
          Request
          Request line and header section (252 bytes) 
          GET http://testphp.vulnweb.com/index.php HTTP/1.1
Host: testphp.vulnweb.com
User-Agent: Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 10.0; Win64; x64; rv:92.0) Gecko/20100101 Firefox/92.0
Pragma: no-cache
Cache-Control: no-cache
Referer: http://testphp.vulnweb.com
          Request body (0 bytes)
          Response
          Status line and header section (200 bytes) 
          HTTP/1.1 200 OK
Server: nginx/1.19.0
Date: Mon, 25 Jul 2022 13:37:41 GMT

<div style="background-color:lightgray;width:100%;text-align:center;font-size:12px;padding:1px">
<p style="padding-left:5%;padding-right:5%"><b>Warning</b>: This is not a real shop. This is an example PHP application, which is intentionally vulnerable to web attacks. It is intended to help you test Acunetix. It also helps you understand how developer errors and bad configuration may let someone break into your website. You can use it to test other tools and your manual hacking skills as well. Tip: Look for potential SQL Injections, Cross-site Scripting (XSS), and Cross-site Request Forgery (CSRF), and more.</p>
</div>

<!-- InstanceEnd --></html>
          Parameter 
          X-Frame-Options
          Solution

          Most modern Web browsers support the X-Frame-Options HTTP header. Ensure it's set on all web pages returned by your site (if you expect the page to be framed only by pages on your server (e.g. it's part of a FRAMESET) then you'll want to use SAMEORIGIN, otherwise if you never expect the page to be framed, you should use DENY. Alternatively consider implementing Content Security Policy's "frame-ancestors" directive.

        15. GET http://testphp.vulnweb.com/listproducts.php?artist=1
          Alert tags
          • OWASP_2021_A05
          • WSTG-v42-CLNT-09
          • OWASP_2017_A06
          Alert description

          X-Frame-Options header is not included in the HTTP response to protect against 'ClickJacking' attacks.
          Request
          Request line and header section (289 bytes) 
          GET http://testphp.vulnweb.com/listproducts.php?artist=1 HTTP/1.1
Host: testphp.vulnweb.com
User-Agent: Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 10.0; Win64; x64; rv:92.0) Gecko/20100101 Firefox/92.0
Pragma: no-cache
Cache-Control: no-cache
Referer: http://testphp.vulnweb.com/artists.php?artist=1
          Request body (0 bytes)
          Response
          Status line and header section (200 bytes) 
          HTTP/1.1 200 OK
Server: nginx/1.19.0
Date: Mon, 25 Jul 2022 13:37:47 GMT
Content-Type: text/html; charset=UTF-8
Connection: keep-alive
X-Powered-By: PHP/5.6.40-38+ubuntu20.04.1+deb.sury.org+1
          Response body (7994 bytes)

          Parameter 
          X-Frame-Options
          Solution

          Most modern Web browsers support the X-Frame-Options HTTP header. Ensure it's set on all web pages returned by your site (if you expect the page to be framed only by pages on your server (e.g. it's part of a FRAMESET) then you'll want to use SAMEORIGIN, otherwise if you never expect the page to be framed, you should use DENY. Alternatively consider implementing Content Security Policy's "frame-ancestors" directive.

          Parameter 
          X-Frame-Options
          Solution

          Most modern Web browsers support the X-Frame-Options HTTP header.           Alert tags
          • OWASP_2021_A05
          • WSTG-v42-CLNT-09
          • OWASP_2017_A06
          Alert description

          X-Frame-Options header is not included in the HTTP response to protect against 'ClickJacking' attacks.
          Request
          Request line and header section (289 bytes) 
          GET http://testphp.vulnweb.com/listproducts.php?artist=3 HTTP/1.1
Host: testphp.vulnweb.com
User-Agent: Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 10.0; Win64; x64; rv:92.0) Gecko/20100101 Firefox/92.0
Pragma: no-cache
Cache-Control: no-cache
Referer: http://testphp.vulnweb.com/artists.php?artist=3
          Request body (0 bytes)

          HTTP/1.1 200 OK
Server: nginx/1.19.0
Date: Mon, 25 Jul 2022 13:37:47 GMT
Content-Type: text/html; charset=UTF-8
Connection: keep-alive
X-Powered-By: PHP/5.6.40-38+ubuntu20.04.1+deb.sury.org+1

          <!DOCTYPE HTML PUBLIC "-//W3C//DTD HTML 4.01 Transitional//EN"

<p style="padding-left:5%;padding-right:5%"><b>Warning</b>: This is not a real shop. This is an example PHP application, which is intentionally vulnerable to web attacks. It is intended to help you test Acunetix. It also helps you understand how developer errors and bad configuration may let someone break into your website. You can use it to test other tools and your manual hacking skills as well. Tip: Look for potential SQL Injections, Cross-site Scripting (XSS), and Cross-site Request Forgery (CSRF), and more.</p>

<!-- InstanceEnd --></html>
          Parameter 
          X-Frame-Options
          Solution

          Most modern Web browsers support the X-Frame-Options HTTP header. Ensure it's set on all web pages returned by your site (if you expect the page to be framed only by pages on your server (e.g. it's part of a FRAMESET) then you'll want to use SAMEORIGIN, otherwise if you never expect the page to be framed, you should use DENY. Alternatively consider implementing Content Security Policy's "frame-ancestors" directive.

        18. GET http://testphp.vulnweb.com/listproducts.php?cat=1
          Alert tags
          • OWASP_2021_A05
          • WSTG-v42-CLNT-09
          • OWASP_2017_A06
          Alert description

          X-Frame-Options header is not included in the HTTP response to protect against 'ClickJacking' attacks.
          Request
          Request line and header section (280 bytes) 
          GET http://testphp.vulnweb.com/listproducts.php?cat=1 HTTP/1.1
Host: testphp.vulnweb.com
User-Agent: Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 10.0; Win64; x64; rv:92.0) Gecko/20100101 Firefox/92.0
Pragma: no-cache
Cache-Control: no-cache
Referer: http://testphp.vulnweb.com/categories.php
          Request body (0 bytes)
          Response
          Status line and header section (200 bytes) 
          HTTP/1.1 200 OK

          Parameter 
          X-Frame-Options
          Solution

          Most modern Web browsers support the X-Frame-Options HTTP header. Ensure it's set on all web pages returned by your site (if you expect the page to be framed only by pages on your server (e.g. it's part of a FRAMESET) then you'll want to use SAMEORIGIN, otherwise if you never expect the page to be framed, you should use DENY. Alternatively consider implementing Content Security Policy's "frame-ancestors" directive.

          X-Frame-Options
          Solution

          Most modern Web browsers support the X-Frame-Options HTTP header. Ensure it's set on all web pages returned by your site (if you expect the page to be framed only by pages on your server (e.g. it's part of a FRAMESET) then you'll want to use SAMEORIGIN, otherwise if you never expect the page to be framed, you should use DENY. Alternatively consider implementing Content Security Policy's "frame-ancestors" directive.

        20. GET http://testphp.vulnweb.com/listproducts.php?cat=3
          Alert tags
          • OWASP_2021_A05
          • WSTG-v42-CLNT-09
          • OWASP_2017_A06
          Alert description

          X-Frame-Options header is not included in the HTTP response to protect against 'ClickJacking' attacks.
          Request
          Request line and header section (280 bytes) 
          GET http://testphp.vulnweb.com/listproducts.php?cat=3 HTTP/1.1
Host: testphp.vulnweb.com
User-Agent: Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 10.0; Win64; x64; rv:92.0) Gecko/20100101 Firefox/92.0
Pragma: no-cache
Cache-Control: no-cache
Referer: http://testphp.vulnweb.com/categories.php
          Request body (0 bytes)
          Response
          Status line and header section (200 bytes) 
          HTTP/1.1 200 OK
Server: nginx/1.19.0
Date: Mon, 25 Jul 2022 13:37:42 GMT
Content-Type: text/html; charset=UTF-8
Connection: keep-alive
X-Powered-By: PHP/5.6.40-38+ubuntu20.04.1+deb.sury.org+1
          Response body (4699 bytes) 
          <!DOCTYPE HTML PUBLIC "-//W3C//DTD HTML 4.01 Transitional//EN"
"http://www.w3.org/TR/html4/loose.dtd">

          Parameter 
          X-Frame-Options
          Solution

          Most modern Web browsers support the X-Frame-Options HTTP header. Ensure it's set on all web pages returned by your site (if you expect the page to be framed only by pages on your server (e.g. it's part of a FRAMESET) then you'll want to use SAMEORIGIN, otherwise if you never expect the page to be framed, you should use DENY. Alternatively consider implementing Content Security Policy's "frame-ancestors" directive.

          Parameter 
          X-Frame-Options
          Solution

          Most modern Web browsers support the X-Frame-Options HTTP header. Ensure it's set on all web pages returned by your site (if you expect the page to be framed only by pages on your server (e.g. it's part of a FRAMESET) then you'll want to use SAMEORIGIN, otherwise if you never expect the page to be framed, you should use DENY. Alternatively consider implementing Content Security Policy's "frame-ancestors" directive.

          Parameter 
          X-Frame-Options
          Solution

          Most modern Web browsers support the X-Frame-Options HTTP header. Ensure it's set on all web pages returned by your site (if you expect the page to be framed only by pages on your server (e.g. it's part of a FRAMESET) then you'll want to use SAMEORIGIN, otherwise if you never expect the page to be framed, you should use DENY. Alternatively consider implementing Content Security Policy's "frame-ancestors" directive.

        23. GET http://testphp.vulnweb.com/Mod_Rewrite_Shop/
          Alert tags
          • OWASP_2021_A05
          • WSTG-v42-CLNT-09
          • OWASP_2017_A06
          Alert description

          X-Frame-Options header is not included in the HTTP response to protect against 'ClickJacking' attacks.

          Parameter 
          X-Frame-Options
          Solution

          Most modern Web browsers support the X-Frame-Options HTTP header. Ensure it's set on all web pages returned by your site (if you expect the page to be framed only by pages on your server (e.g. it's part of a FRAMESET) then you'll want to use SAMEORIGIN, otherwise if you never expect the page to be framed, you should use DENY. Alternatively consider implementing Content Security Policy's "frame-ancestors" directive.

        24. GET http://testphp.vulnweb.com/Mod_Rewrite_Shop/BuyProduct-1/
          Alert tags
          • OWASP_2021_A05
          • WSTG-v42-CLNT-09
          • OWASP_2017_A06
          Alert description

          X-Frame-Options header is not included in the HTTP response to protect against 'ClickJacking' attacks.
          Request
          Request line and header section (332 bytes) 
          GET http://testphp.vulnweb.com/Mod_Rewrite_Shop/BuyProduct-1/ HTTP/1.1
Host: testphp.vulnweb.com
User-Agent: Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 10.0; Win64; x64; rv:92.0) Gecko/20100101 Firefox/92.0
Pragma: no-cache
Cache-Control: no-cache
Referer: http://testphp.vulnweb.com/Mod_Rewrite_Shop/Details/network-attached-storage-dlink/1/
          Request body (0 bytes)
          Response
          Status line and header section (200 bytes) 
          HTTP/1.1 200 OK
Server: nginx/1.19.0
Date: Mon, 25 Jul 2022 13:37:47 GMT
Content-Type: text/html; charset=UTF-8
Connection: keep-alive
X-Powered-By: PHP/5.6.40-38+ubuntu20.04.1+deb.sury.org+1
          Response body (100 bytes) 
          <div>Thanks for buying <b> Network Storage D-Link DNS-313 enclosure 1 x SATA</b><br><br></div>
          Parameter 
          X-Frame-Options
          Solution

          Most modern Web browsers support the X-Frame-Options HTTP header. Ensure it's set on all web pages returned by your site (if you expect the page to be framed only by pages on your server (e.g. it's part of a FRAMESET) then you'll want to use SAMEORIGIN, otherwise if you never expect the page to be framed, you should use DENY. Alternatively consider implementing Content Security Policy's "frame-ancestors" directive.

<p style="padding-left:5%;padding-right:5%"><b>Warning</b>: This is not a real shop. This is an example PHP application, which is intentionally vulnerable to web attacks. It is intended to help you test Acunetix. It also helps you understand how developer errors and bad configuration may let someone break into your website. You can use it to test other tools and your manual hacking skills as well. Tip: Look for potential SQL Injections, Cross-site Scripting (XSS), and Cross-site Request Forgery (CSRF), and more.</p>

          Parameter 
          X-Frame-Options
          Solution

          Most modern Web browsers support the X-Frame-Options HTTP header. Ensure it's set on all web pages returned by your site (if you expect the page to be framed only by pages on your server (e.g. it's part of a FRAMESET) then you'll want to use SAMEORIGIN, otherwise if you never expect the page to be framed, you should use DENY. Alternatively consider implementing Content Security Policy's "frame-ancestors" directive.

        34. GET http://testphp.vulnweb.com/product.php?pic=2
          Alert tags
          • OWASP_2021_A05
          • WSTG-v42-CLNT-09
          • OWASP_2017_A06
          Alert description

          X-Frame-Options header is not included in the HTTP response to protect against 'ClickJacking' attacks.
          Request
          Request line and header section (283 bytes) 
          GET http://testphp.vulnweb.com/product.php?pic=2 HTTP/1.1
Host: testphp.vulnweb.com
User-Agent: Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 10.0; Win64; x64; rv:92.0) Gecko/20100101 Firefox/92.0
Pragma: no-cache
Cache-Control: no-cache

<p style="padding-left:5%;padding-right:5%"><b>Warning</b>: This is not a real shop. This is an example PHP application, which is intentionally vulnerable to web attacks. It is intended to help you test Acunetix. It also helps you understand how developer errors and bad configuration may let someone break into your website. You can use it to test other tools and your manual hacking skills as well. Tip: Look for potential SQL Injections, Cross-site Scripting (XSS), and Cross-site Request Forgery (CSRF), and more.</p>

<!-- InstanceEnd --></html>
          Parameter 
          X-Frame-Options
          Solution

          Most modern Web browsers support the X-Frame-Options HTTP header. Ensure it's set on all web pages returned by your site (if you expect the page to be framed only by pages on your server (e.g. it's part of a FRAMESET) then you'll want to use SAMEORIGIN, otherwise if you never expect the page to be framed, you should use DENY. Alternatively consider implementing Content Security Policy's "frame-ancestors" directive.

        35. GET http://testphp.vulnweb.com/product.php?pic=3
          Alert tags
          • OWASP_2021_A05
          • WSTG-v42-CLNT-09
          • OWASP_2017_A06
          Alert description

          X-Frame-Options header is not included in the HTTP response to protect against 'ClickJacking' attacks.
          Request
          Request line and header section (283 bytes) 
          GET http://testphp.vulnweb.com/product.php?pic=3 HTTP/1.1
Host: testphp.vulnweb.com
User-Agent: Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 10.0; Win64; x64; rv:92.0) Gecko/20100101 Firefox/92.0
Pragma: no-cache
Cache-Control: no-cache
Referer: http://testphp.vulnweb.com/listproducts.php?cat=1
          Request body (0 bytes)
          Response
          Status line and header section (200 bytes) 
          HTTP/1.1 200 OK

          X-Frame-Options

<p style="padding-left:5%;padding-right:5%"><b>Warning</b>: This is not a real shop. This is an example PHP application, which is intentionally vulnerable to web attacks. It is intended to help you test Acunetix. It also helps you understand how developer errors and bad configuration may let someone break into your website. You can use it to test other tools and your manual hacking skills as well. Tip: Look for potential SQL Injections, Cross-site Scripting (XSS), and Cross-site Request Forgery (CSRF), and more.</p>
</div>
</div>
</body>
<!-- InstanceEnd --></html>
          Parameter 
          X-Frame-Options
          Solution

          Most modern Web browsers support the X-Frame-Options HTTP header. Ensure it's set on all web pages returned by your site (if you expect the page to be framed only by pages on your server (e.g. it's part of a FRAMESET) then you'll want to use SAMEORIGIN, otherwise if you never expect the page to be framed, you should use DENY. Alternatively consider implementing Content Security Policy's "frame-ancestors" directive.

        37. GET http://testphp.vulnweb.com/product.php?pic=5
          Alert tags
          • OWASP_2021_A05
          • WSTG-v42-CLNT-09
          • OWASP_2017_A06
          Alert description

          X-Frame-Options header is not included in the HTTP response to protect against 'ClickJacking' attacks.
          Request
          Request line and header section (283 bytes) 
          GET http://testphp.vulnweb.com/product.php?pic=5 HTTP/1.1
Host: testphp.vulnweb.com
User-Agent: Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 10.0; Win64; x64; rv:92.0) Gecko/20100101 Firefox/92.0
Pragma: no-cache
Cache-Control: no-cache
Referer: http://testphp.vulnweb.com/listproducts.php?cat=1
          Request body (0 bytes)
          Response
          Status line and header section (200 bytes) 
          HTTP/1.1 200 OK
Server: nginx/1.19.0
Date: Mon, 25 Jul 2022 13:37:45 GMT
Content-Type: text/html; charset=UTF-8
Connection: keep-alive
X-Powered-By: PHP/5.6.40-38+ubuntu20.04.1+deb.sury.org+1
          Response body (6382 bytes) 
          <!DOCTYPE HTML PUBLIC "-//W3C//DTD HTML 4.01 Transitional//EN"
"http://www.w3.org/TR/html4/loose.dtd">

          Parameter 
          X-Frame-Options
          Solution

          Most modern Web browsers support the X-Frame-Options HTTP header. Ensure it's set on all web pages returned by your site (if you expect the page to be framed only by pages on your server (e.g. it's part of a FRAMESET) then you'll want to use SAMEORIGIN, otherwise if you never expect the page to be framed, you should use DENY. Alternatively consider implementing Content Security Policy's "frame-ancestors" directive.

        <param name="movie" value="Flash/add.swf">
        <param name=quality value=high>
        <embed src="Flash/add.swf" quality=high pluginspage="http://www.macromedia.com/shockwave/download/index.cgi?P1_Prod_Version=ShockwaveFlash" type="application/x-shockwave-flash" width="107" height="66"></embed>
      </object>
    </p>
  </div> 
</div> 

<!--end navbar --> 
<div id="siteInfo">  <a href="http://www.acunetix.com">About Us</a> | <a href="privacy.php">Privacy Policy</a> | <a href="mailto:wvs@acunetix.com">Contact Us</a> | &copy;2019
  Acunetix Ltd 
</div> 
<br> 
<div style="background-color:lightgray;width:100%;text-align:center;font-size:12px;padding:1px">
<p style="padding-left:5%;padding-right:5%"><b>Warning</b>: This is not a real shop. This is an example PHP application, which is intentionally vulnerable to web attacks. It is intended to help you test Acunetix. It also helps you understand how developer errors and bad configuration may let someone break into your website. You can use it to test other tools and your manual hacking skills as well. Tip: Look for potential SQL Injections, Cross-site Scripting (XSS), and Cross-site Request Forgery (CSRF), and more.</p>
</div>
</div>
</body>
<!-- InstanceEnd --></html>
          Parameter 
          X-Frame-Options
          Solution

          Most modern Web browsers support the X-Frame-Options HTTP header. Ensure it's set on all web pages returned by your site (if you expect the page to be framed only by pages on your server (e.g. it's part of a FRAMESET) then you'll want to use SAMEORIGIN, otherwise if you never expect the page to be framed, you should use DENY. Alternatively consider implementing Content Security Policy's "frame-ancestors" directive.

        40. GET http://testphp.vulnweb.com/signup.php
          Alert tags
          • OWASP_2021_A05
          • WSTG-v42-CLNT-09
          • OWASP_2017_A06
          Alert description

          X-Frame-Options header is not included in the HTTP response to protect against 'ClickJacking' attacks.
          Request
          Request line and header section (263 bytes) 
          GET http://testphp.vulnweb.com/signup.php HTTP/1.1
Host: testphp.vulnweb.com
User-Agent: Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 10.0; Win64; x64; rv:92.0) Gecko/20100101 Firefox/92.0
Pragma: no-cache
Cache-Control: no-cache
Referer: http://testphp.vulnweb.com/login.php
          Request body (0 bytes)
          Response
          Status line and header section (200 bytes) 
          HTTP/1.1 200 OK
Server: nginx/1.19.0
Date: Mon, 25 Jul 2022 13:37:43 GMT
Content-Type: text/html; charset=UTF-8
Connection: keep-alive
X-Powered-By: PHP/5.6.40-38+ubuntu20.04.1+deb.sury.org+1
          Response body (6033 bytes) 
          <!DOCTYPE HTML PUBLIC "-//W3C//DTD HTML 4.01 Transitional//EN"
"http://www.w3.org/TR/html4/loose.dtd">
<html><!-- InstanceBegin template="/Templates/main_dynamic_template.dwt.php" codeOutsideHTMLIsLocked="false" -->

          Parameter 
          X-Frame-Options
          Solution

          Most modern Web browsers support the X-Frame-Options HTTP header. Ensure it's set on all web pages returned by your site (if you expect the page to be framed only by pages on your server (e.g. it's part of a FRAMESET) then you'll want to use SAMEORIGIN, otherwise if you never expect the page to be framed, you should use DENY. Alternatively consider implementing Content Security Policy's "frame-ancestors" directive.

        41. POST http://testphp.vulnweb.com/cart.php
          Alert tags
          • OWASP_2021_A05
          • WSTG-v42-CLNT-09
          • OWASP_2017_A06

          X-Frame-Options header is not included in the HTTP response to protect against 'ClickJacking' attacks.

Pragma: no-cache
Cache-Control: no-cache
Content-Type: application/x-www-form-urlencoded

          Request body (19 bytes) 
          price=800&addcart=2
          Response
          Status line and header section (200 bytes) 
          HTTP/1.1 200 OK

          Parameter 
          X-Frame-Options
          Solution

          Most modern Web browsers support the X-Frame-Options HTTP header. Ensure it's set on all web pages returned by your site (if you expect the page to be framed only by pages on your server (e.g. it's part of a FRAMESET) then you'll want to use SAMEORIGIN, otherwise if you never expect the page to be framed, you should use DENY. Alternatively consider implementing Content Security Policy's "frame-ancestors" directive.

        42. POST http://testphp.vulnweb.com/guestbook.php
          Alert tags
          • OWASP_2021_A05
          • WSTG-v42-CLNT-09
          • OWASP_2017_A06
          Alert description

          X-Frame-Options header is not included in the HTTP response to protect against 'ClickJacking' attacks.

          Request line and header section (340 bytes) 
          POST http://testphp.vulnweb.com/guestbook.php HTTP/1.1

Pragma: no-cache
Cache-Control: no-cache
Content-Type: application/x-www-form-urlencoded

          name=ZAP&text=&submit=add+message

          Parameter 
          X-Frame-Options
          Solution

          Most modern Web browsers support the X-Frame-Options HTTP header. Ensure it's set on all web pages returned by your site (if you expect the page to be framed only by pages on your server (e.g. it's part of a FRAMESET) then you'll want to use SAMEORIGIN, otherwise if you never expect the page to be framed, you should use DENY. Alternatively consider implementing Content Security Policy's "frame-ancestors" directive.

        43. POST http://testphp.vulnweb.com/search.php?test=query
          Alert tags
          • OWASP_2021_A05
          • WSTG-v42-CLNT-09
          • OWASP_2017_A06
          Alert description

          X-Frame-Options header is not included in the HTTP response to protect against 'ClickJacking' attacks.
          Request
          Request line and header section (334 bytes) 
          POST http://testphp.vulnweb.com/search.php?test=query HTTP/1.1

User-Agent: Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 10.0; Win64; x64; rv:92.0) Gecko/20100101 Firefox/92.0
Pragma: no-cache
Cache-Control: no-cache
Content-Type: application/x-www-form-urlencoded
Referer: http://testphp.vulnweb.com
Content-Length: 25
          Request body (25 bytes) 
          searchFor=ZAP&goButton=go
          Response
          Status line and header section (200 bytes) 
          HTTP/1.1 200 OK

Connection: keep-alive
X-Powered-By: PHP/5.6.40-38+ubuntu20.04.1+deb.sury.org+1
          Response body (4772 bytes) 
          <!DOCTYPE HTML PUBLIC "-//W3C//DTD HTML 4.01 Transitional//EN"
"http://www.w3.org/TR/html4/loose.dtd">

It is intended to help you test Acunetix. It also helps you understand how developer errors and bad configuration may let someone break into your website. You can use it to test other tools and your manual hacking skills as well. Tip: Look for potential SQL Injections, Cross-site Scripting (XSS), and Cross-site Request Forgery (CSRF), and more.</p>

          Parameter 
          X-Frame-Options
          Solution

          Most modern Web browsers support the X-Frame-Options HTTP header. Ensure it's set on all web pages returned by your site (if you expect the page to be framed only by pages on your server (e.g. it's part of a FRAMESET) then you'll want to use SAMEORIGIN, otherwise if you never expect the page to be framed, you should use DENY. Alternatively consider implementing Content Security Policy's "frame-ancestors" directive.

        44. POST http://testphp.vulnweb.com/secured/newuser.php
          Alert tags
          • OWASP_2021_A05
          • WSTG-v42-CLNT-09
          • OWASP_2017_A06
          Alert description

          X-Frame-Options header is not included in the HTTP response to protect against 'ClickJacking' attacks.

          Parameter 
          X-Frame-Options
          Solution

          Most modern Web browsers support the X-Frame-Options HTTP header. Ensure it's set on all web pages returned by your site (if you expect the page to be framed only by pages on your server (e.g. it's part of a FRAMESET) then you'll want to use SAMEORIGIN, otherwise if you never expect the page to be framed, you should use DENY. Alternatively consider implementing Content Security Policy's "frame-ancestors" directive.

  2. Risk=低, Confidence=中等的 (169)

    1. http://testphp.vulnweb.com (169)

      1. Server Leaks Information via "X-Powered-By" HTTP Response Header Field(s) (62)
        1. GET http://testphp.vulnweb.com
          Alert tags
          • OWASP_2021_A01
          • WSTG-v42-INFO-08
          • OWASP_2017_A03
          Alert description

          The web/application server is leaking information via one or more "X-Powered-By" HTTP response headers. Access to such information may facilitate attackers identifying other frameworks/components your web application is reliant upon and the vulnerabilities such components may be subject to.
          Request
          Request line and header section (205 bytes) 
          GET http://testphp.vulnweb.com HTTP/1.1
Host: testphp.vulnweb.com
User-Agent: Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 10.0; Win64; x64; rv:92.0) Gecko/20100101 Firefox/92.0
Pragma: no-cache
Cache-Control: no-cache
          Request body (0 bytes)
          Response
          Status line and header section (200 bytes) 
          HTTP/1.1 200 OK
Server: nginx/1.19.0
Date: Mon, 25 Jul 2022 13:37:39 GMT
Content-Type: text/html; charset=UTF-8
Connection: keep-alive
X-Powered-By: PHP/5.6.40-38+ubuntu20.04.1+deb.sury.org+1
          Response body (4958 bytes) 
          <!DOCTYPE HTML PUBLIC "-//W3C//DTD HTML 4.01 Transitional//EN"
"http://www.w3.org/TR/html4/loose.dtd">

<div style="background-color:lightgray;width:100%;text-align:center;font-size:12px;padding:1px">
<p style="padding-left:5%;padding-right:5%"><b>Warning</b>: This is not a real shop. This is an example PHP application, which is intentionally vulnerable to web attacks. It is intended to help you test Acunetix. It also helps you understand how developer errors and bad configuration may let someone break into your website. You can use it to test other tools and your manual hacking skills as well. Tip: Look for potential SQL Injections, Cross-site Scripting (XSS), and Cross-site Request Forgery (CSRF), and more.</p>

          Evidence 
          X-Powered-By: PHP/5.6.40-38+ubuntu20.04.1+deb.sury.org+1
          Solution

          Ensure that your web server, application server, load balancer, etc. is configured to suppress "X-Powered-By" headers.
        2. GET http://testphp.vulnweb.com/AJAX/index.php
          Alert tags
          • OWASP_2021_A01
          • WSTG-v42-INFO-08
          • OWASP_2017_A03
          Alert description

          The web/application server is leaking information via one or more "X-Powered-By" HTTP response headers. Access to such information may facilitate attackers identifying other frameworks/components your web application is reliant upon and the vulnerabilities such components may be subject to.
          Request
          Request line and header section (257 bytes) 
          GET http://testphp.vulnweb.com/AJAX/index.php HTTP/1.1
Host: testphp.vulnweb.com
User-Agent: Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 10.0; Win64; x64; rv:92.0) Gecko/20100101 Firefox/92.0
Pragma: no-cache
Cache-Control: no-cache
Referer: http://testphp.vulnweb.com
          Request body (0 bytes)
          Response
          Status line and header section (200 bytes) 
          HTTP/1.1 200 OK
Server: nginx/1.19.0
Date: Mon, 25 Jul 2022 13:37:41 GMT
Content-Type: text/html; charset=UTF-8
Connection: keep-alive
X-Powered-By: PHP/5.6.40-38+ubuntu20.04.1+deb.sury.org+1
          Response body (4236 bytes) 
          <!DOCTYPE html PUBLIC "-//W3C//DTD XHTML 1.0 Transitional//EN" "http://www.w3.org/TR/xhtml1/DTD/xhtml1-transitional.dtd">
<html xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml">
<head>
<meta http-equiv="Content-Type" content="text/html; charset=iso-8859-1" />
<title>ajax test</title>
<link href="styles.css" rel="stylesheet" type="text/css" />
<script type="text/javascript">
	var httpreq = null;	

	function SetContent(XML) {
		var items = XML.getElementsByTagName('items').item(0).getElementsByTagName('item');
		var inner = '<ul>';
		for(i=0; i<items.length; i++){
			inner = inner + '<li><a href="javascript:getInfo(\'' + items[i].attributes.item(0).value + '\', \'' + items[i].attributes.item(1).value + '\')">' + items[i].firstChild.nodeValue + '</a></li>';
		}
		
		inner = inner + '</ul>'
		
		cd = document.getElementById('contentDiv');
		cd.innerHTML = inner;
		
		id = document.getElementById('infoDiv');
		id.innerHTML = '';
	}

	function httpCompleted() {
		if (httpreq.readyState==4 && httpreq.status==200) {						
			SetContent(httpreq.responseXML);
			httpreq = null;
		}		
	}
	
	function SetInfo(XML) {
		var ii = XML.getElementsByTagName('iteminfo').item(0);
		var inner = '';
		
		inner = inner + '<p><strong>' + ii.getElementsByTagName('name').item(0).firstChild.nodeValue + '</strong></p>';
		
		pict  = ii.getElementsByTagName('picture');
		if(pict.length>0){
			inner = inner + '<img src="../showimage.php?file=' + pict.item(0).firstChild.nodeValue + '"/>';
		}
		
		descs = ii.getElementsByTagName('description');
		for (i=0; i<descs.length; i++){
			inner = inner + '<p>' + descs.item(i).firstChild.nodeValue + '</p>';
		}
		
		id = document.getElementById('infoDiv');
		id.innerHTML = inner;
	}
	
	function httpInfoCompleted() {		
		if (httpreq.readyState==4 && httpreq.status==200) {
			SetInfo(httpreq.responseXML);
			httpreq = null;
		}		
	}
	
	function loadSomething(what) {			
		getHttpRequest();		
		httpreq.open('GET', what, true);		
		httpreq.send('');
	}
	
	function getInfo(where, which) {
		getHttpRequest();		
		httpreq.onreadystatechange = httpInfoCompleted;
		if (where=='infotitle'){
			httpreq.open('POST', where+'.php', true);
			httpreq.setRequestHeader('content-type', 'application/x-www-form-urlencoded');
			httpreq.send('id='+which);
		}
		else {
			httpreq.open('GET', where+'.php?id='+which, true);
			httpreq.send('');
		}
	}
	
	function xmlCompleted () {
		if (httpreq.readyState==4 && httpreq.status==200) {
			xd = document.getElementById('xmlDiv');
			xd.innerHTML = httpreq.responseText;
			httpreq = null;
		}	
	}
	
	function sendXML () {
		getHttpRequest();
		httpreq.onreadystatechange = xmlCompleted;
		httpreq.open('POST', 'showxml.php');
		httpreq.setRequestHeader('content-type', 'text/xml');
		httpreq.send('<xml><node name="nodename1">nodetext1</node><node name="nodename2">nodetext2</node></xml>');
	}
	
	function getHttpRequest() {
		// free the curent one
		if (httpreq!=null){
			httpreq.abort();
			httpreq = null;
		}		

    if( window.XMLHttpRequest ) {
			httpreq = new XMLHttpRequest();
			if (httpreq.overrideMimeType) {
					httpreq.overrideMimeType('text/xml');
			}
    } else if(ActiveXObject) {
     	httpreq = new ActiveXObject("Msxml2.XMLHTTP");
		}
			httpreq.onreadystatechange = httpCompleted;
	}
	
	function SetMyCookie() {
		document.cookie = "mycookie=3";
		alert('A cookie was set by JavaScript.');
	}
</script>
</head>
<body>
<table border="0" cellpadding="3" width="500" align="center">
  <tr>
    <td class="bordered">
			<a href="javascript:loadSomething('artists.php');">artists</a> |
			<a href="javascript:loadSomething('categories.php');">categories</a> | 
			<a href="#" onclick="loadSomething('titles.php')">titles</a> |
			<a href="#" onclick="sendXML()">send xml</a> |
			<a href="#" onclick="SetMyCookie()">setcookie</a>
		</td>
  </tr>
  <tr>
    <td>
			<div id="contentDiv">
				&nbsp;
			</div>
		</td>
  </tr>
	<tr>
    <td>
			<div id="infoDiv">
				&nbsp;
			</div>
		</td>
  </tr>
	
	<tr>
    <td>
			<div id="xmlDiv">
				&nbsp;
			</div>
		</td>
  </tr>
</table>
</body>
</html>
          Evidence 
          X-Powered-By: PHP/5.6.40-38+ubuntu20.04.1+deb.sury.org+1
          Solution

          Ensure that your web server, application server, load balancer, etc. is configured to suppress "X-Powered-By" headers.
        3. GET http://testphp.vulnweb.com/artists.php
          Alert tags
          • OWASP_2021_A01
          • WSTG-v42-INFO-08
          • OWASP_2017_A03
          Alert description

          The web/application server is leaking information via one or more "X-Powered-By" HTTP response headers. Access to such information may facilitate attackers identifying other frameworks/components your web application is reliant upon and the vulnerabilities such components may be subject to.
          Request
          Request line and header section (254 bytes) 
          GET http://testphp.vulnweb.com/artists.php HTTP/1.1
Host: testphp.vulnweb.com
User-Agent: Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 10.0; Win64; x64; rv:92.0) Gecko/20100101 Firefox/92.0
Pragma: no-cache
Cache-Control: no-cache
Referer: http://testphp.vulnweb.com
          Request body (0 bytes)
          Response
          Status line and header section (200 bytes) 
          HTTP/1.1 200 OK

<div style="background-color:lightgray;width:100%;text-align:center;font-size:12px;padding:1px">
<p style="padding-left:5%;padding-right:5%"><b>Warning</b>: This is not a real shop. This is an example PHP application, which is intentionally vulnerable to web attacks. It is intended to help you test Acunetix. It also helps you understand how developer errors and bad configuration may let someone break into your website. You can use it to test other tools and your manual hacking skills as well. Tip: Look for potential SQL Injections, Cross-site Scripting (XSS), and Cross-site Request Forgery (CSRF), and more.</p>
</div>

<!-- InstanceEnd --></html>
          Evidence 
          X-Powered-By: PHP/5.6.40-38+ubuntu20.04.1+deb.sury.org+1
          Solution

          Ensure that your web server, application server, load balancer, etc. is configured to suppress "X-Powered-By" headers.
        4. GET http://testphp.vulnweb.com/artists.php?artist=1
          Alert tags
          • OWASP_2021_A01
          • WSTG-v42-INFO-08
          • OWASP_2017_A03
          Alert description

          The web/application server is leaking information via one or more "X-Powered-By" HTTP response headers. Access to such information may facilitate attackers identifying other frameworks/components your web application is reliant upon and the vulnerabilities such components may be subject to.
          Request
          Request line and header section (275 bytes) 
          GET http://testphp.vulnweb.com/artists.php?artist=1 HTTP/1.1
Host: testphp.vulnweb.com
User-Agent: Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 10.0; Win64; x64; rv:92.0) Gecko/20100101 Firefox/92.0
Pragma: no-cache
Cache-Control: no-cache
Referer: http://testphp.vulnweb.com/artists.php
          Request body (0 bytes)
          Response
          Status line and header section (200 bytes) 
          HTTP/1.1 200 OK
Server: nginx/1.19.0
Date: Mon, 25 Jul 2022 13:37:43 GMT
Content-Type: text/html; charset=UTF-8
Connection: keep-alive
X-Powered-By: PHP/5.6.40-38+ubuntu20.04.1+deb.sury.org+1
          Response body (6251 bytes) 
          <!DOCTYPE HTML PUBLIC "-//W3C//DTD HTML 4.01 Transitional//EN"
"http://www.w3.org/TR/html4/loose.dtd">

	<h2 id='pageName'>artist: r4w8173</h2><div class='story'><p><p>
Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet, consectetuer adipiscing elit. Donec molestie.
    Sed aliquam sem ut arcu. Phasellus sollicitudin. Vestibulum condimentum facilisis
    nulla. In hac habitasse platea dictumst. Nulla nonummy. Cras quis libero.
    Cras venenatis. Aliquam posuere lobortis pede. Nullam fringilla urna id leo.
    Praesent aliquet pretium erat. Praesent non odio. Pellentesque a magna a
    mauris vulputate lacinia. Aenean viverra. Class aptent taciti sociosqu ad
    litora torquent per conubia nostra, per inceptos hymenaeos. Aliquam lacus.
    Mauris magna eros, semper a, tempor et, rutrum et, tortor.
</p>

	<h2 id='pageName'>artist: lyzae</h2><div class='story'><p><p>
Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet, consectetuer adipiscing elit. Donec molestie.
Sed aliquam sem ut arcu. Phasellus sollicitudin. Vestibulum condimentum facilisis
nulla. In hac habitasse platea dictumst. Nulla nonummy. Cras quis libero.
Cras venenatis. Aliquam posuere lobortis pede. Nullam fringilla urna id leo.
Praesent aliquet pretium erat. Praesent non odio. Pellentesque a magna a
mauris vulputate lacinia. Aenean viverra. Class aptent taciti sociosqu ad
litora torquent per conubia nostra, per inceptos hymenaeos. Aliquam lacus.
Mauris magna eros, semper a, tempor et, rutrum et, tortor.
</p>

<p style="padding-left:5%;padding-right:5%"><b>Warning</b>: This is not a real shop. This is an example PHP application, which is intentionally vulnerable to web attacks. It is intended to help you test Acunetix. It also helps you understand how developer errors and bad configuration may let someone break into your website. You can use it to test other tools and your manual hacking skills as well. Tip: Look for potential SQL Injections, Cross-site Scripting (XSS), and Cross-site Request Forgery (CSRF), and more.</p>

<!-- InstanceEnd --></html>
          Evidence 
          X-Powered-By: PHP/5.6.40-38+ubuntu20.04.1+deb.sury.org+1
          Solution

          Ensure that your web server, application server, load balancer, etc. is configured to suppress "X-Powered-By" headers.
        7. GET http://testphp.vulnweb.com/cart.php
          Alert tags
          • OWASP_2021_A01
          • WSTG-v42-INFO-08
          • OWASP_2017_A03
          Alert description

          The web/application server is leaking information via one or more "X-Powered-By" HTTP response headers. Access to such information may facilitate attackers identifying other frameworks/components your web application is reliant upon and the vulnerabilities such components may be subject to.
          Request
          Request line and header section (251 bytes) 
          GET http://testphp.vulnweb.com/cart.php HTTP/1.1
Host: testphp.vulnweb.com
User-Agent: Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 10.0; Win64; x64; rv:92.0) Gecko/20100101 Firefox/92.0
Pragma: no-cache
Cache-Control: no-cache
Referer: http://testphp.vulnweb.com
          Request body (0 bytes)
          Response
          Status line and header section (200 bytes) 
          HTTP/1.1 200 OK
Server: nginx/1.19.0
Date: Mon, 25 Jul 2022 13:37:41 GMT
Content-Type: text/html; charset=UTF-8
Connection: keep-alive
X-Powered-By: PHP/5.6.40-38+ubuntu20.04.1+deb.sury.org+1
          Response body (4903 bytes) 
          <!DOCTYPE HTML PUBLIC "-//W3C//DTD HTML 4.01 Transitional//EN"
"http://www.w3.org/TR/html4/loose.dtd">
<html><!-- InstanceBegin template="/Templates/main_dynamic_template.dwt.php" codeOutsideHTMLIsLocked="false" -->

<!-- InstanceBeginEditable name="document_title_rgn" -->

<!-- InstanceEndEditable -->
<link rel="stylesheet" href="style.css" type="text/css">
<!-- InstanceBeginEditable name="headers_rgn" -->
<!-- here goes headers headers -->

          X-Powered-By: PHP/5.6.40-38+ubuntu20.04.1+deb.sury.org+1
          Solution

          Ensure that your web server, application server, load balancer, etc. is configured to suppress "X-Powered-By" headers.
        8. GET http://testphp.vulnweb.com/categories.php
          Alert tags
          • OWASP_2021_A01
          • WSTG-v42-INFO-08
          • OWASP_2017_A03

          • OWASP_2021_A01

<div id="content">
	<h2 id="pageName">Disclaimer</h2>
	  <div class="story">
		<h6>Please read carefully</h6>
		<p>This website is created to demonstrate the abilities of Acunetix new product <strong>WEB Vulnerability Scanner</strong>.</p>
		It is not intended to be a real online shop. Also this website was constructed with common web programming errors so it is buggy.
		<p>Please do not post any confidential information on this site. Do not give any creditcard number or real address, nor e-mail or
		website addresses.</p>
		<p>Information you post on this site are by no means private nor protected!</p>
		<p>All images on this site were generated with fre software <a href="http://www.eclectasy.com/Fractal-Explorer/index.html" target="_blank">
		<strong>Fractal Explorer</strong></a>.</p>
	  </div>
</div>
<!-- InstanceEndEditable -->
<!--end content -->

<div style="background-color:lightgray;width:100%;text-align:center;font-size:12px;padding:1px">
<p style="padding-left:5%;padding-right:5%"><b>Warning</b>: This is not a real shop. This is an example PHP application, which is intentionally vulnerable to web attacks. It is intended to help you test Acunetix. It also helps you understand how developer errors and bad configuration may let someone break into your website. You can use it to test other tools and your manual hacking skills as well. Tip: Look for potential SQL Injections, Cross-site Scripting (XSS), and Cross-site Request Forgery (CSRF), and more.</p>
</div>

<!-- InstanceEnd --></html>
          Evidence 
          X-Powered-By: PHP/5.6.40-38+ubuntu20.04.1+deb.sury.org+1
          Solution

          Ensure that your web server, application server, load balancer, etc. is configured to suppress "X-Powered-By" headers.
        10. GET http://testphp.vulnweb.com/guestbook.php
          Alert tags
          • OWASP_2021_A01
          • WSTG-v42-INFO-08
          • OWASP_2017_A03
          Alert description

          The web/application server is leaking information via one or more "X-Powered-By" HTTP response headers. Access to such information may facilitate attackers identifying other frameworks/components your web application is reliant upon and the vulnerabilities such components may be subject to.
          Request
          Request line and header section (256 bytes) 
          GET http://testphp.vulnweb.com/guestbook.php HTTP/1.1
Host: testphp.vulnweb.com
User-Agent: Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 10.0; Win64; x64; rv:92.0) Gecko/20100101 Firefox/92.0
Pragma: no-cache
Cache-Control: no-cache
Referer: http://testphp.vulnweb.com
          Request body (0 bytes)
          Response
          Status line and header section (200 bytes) 
          HTTP/1.1 200 OK
Server: nginx/1.19.0
Date: Mon, 25 Jul 2022 13:37:41 GMT
Content-Type: text/html; charset=UTF-8
Connection: keep-alive
X-Powered-By: PHP/5.6.40-38+ubuntu20.04.1+deb.sury.org+1
          Response body (5390 bytes) 
          <!DOCTYPE HTML PUBLIC "-//W3C//DTD HTML 4.01 Transitional//EN"
"http://www.w3.org/TR/html4/loose.dtd">

<p style="padding-left:5%;padding-right:5%"><b>Warning</b>: This is not a real shop. This is an example PHP application, which is intentionally vulnerable to web attacks. It is intended to help you test Acunetix. It also helps you understand how developer errors and bad configuration may let someone break into your website. You can use it to test other tools and your manual hacking skills as well. Tip: Look for potential SQL Injections, Cross-site Scripting (XSS), and Cross-site Request Forgery (CSRF), and more.</p>

          Evidence 
          X-Powered-By: PHP/5.6.40-38+ubuntu20.04.1+deb.sury.org+1
          Solution

          Ensure that your web server, application server, load balancer, etc. is configured to suppress "X-Powered-By" headers.
        11. GET http://testphp.vulnweb.com/hpp/
          Alert tags
          • OWASP_2021_A01
          • WSTG-v42-INFO-08
          • OWASP_2017_A03
          Alert description

          The web/application server is leaking information via one or more "X-Powered-By" HTTP response headers. Access to such information may facilitate attackers identifying other frameworks/components your web application is reliant upon and the vulnerabilities such components may be subject to.
          Request
          Request line and header section (247 bytes) 
          GET http://testphp.vulnweb.com/hpp/ HTTP/1.1
Host: testphp.vulnweb.com
User-Agent: Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 10.0; Win64; x64; rv:92.0) Gecko/20100101 Firefox/92.0
Pragma: no-cache
Cache-Control: no-cache
Referer: http://testphp.vulnweb.com
          Request body (0 bytes)
          Response
          Status line and header section (200 bytes) 
          HTTP/1.1 200 OK
Server: nginx/1.19.0
Date: Mon, 25 Jul 2022 13:37:42 GMT
Content-Type: text/html; charset=UTF-8
Connection: keep-alive
X-Powered-By: PHP/5.6.40-38+ubuntu20.04.1+deb.sury.org+1
          Response body (203 bytes) 
          <title>HTTP Parameter Pollution Example</title>

<a href="?pp=12">check</a><br/>

<hr>
<a href='http://blog.mindedsecurity.com/2009/05/client-side-http-parameter-pollution.html'>Original article</a>
          Evidence 
          X-Powered-By: PHP/5.6.40-38+ubuntu20.04.1+deb.sury.org+1
          Solution

          Ensure that your web server, application server, load balancer, etc. is configured to suppress "X-Powered-By" headers.
        12. GET http://testphp.vulnweb.com/hpp/?pp=12
          Alert tags
          • OWASP_2021_A01
          • WSTG-v42-INFO-08
          • OWASP_2017_A03
          Alert description

          The web/application server is leaking information via one or more "X-Powered-By" HTTP response headers. Access to such information may facilitate attackers identifying other frameworks/components your web application is reliant upon and the vulnerabilities such components may be subject to.
          Request
          Request line and header section (258 bytes) 
          GET http://testphp.vulnweb.com/hpp/?pp=12 HTTP/1.1
Host: testphp.vulnweb.com
User-Agent: Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 10.0; Win64; x64; rv:92.0) Gecko/20100101 Firefox/92.0
Pragma: no-cache
Cache-Control: no-cache
Referer: http://testphp.vulnweb.com/hpp/
          Request body (0 bytes)
          Response
          Status line and header section (200 bytes) 
          HTTP/1.1 200 OK
Server: nginx/1.19.0
Date: Mon, 25 Jul 2022 13:37:44 GMT
Content-Type: text/html; charset=UTF-8
Connection: keep-alive
X-Powered-By: PHP/5.6.40-38+ubuntu20.04.1+deb.sury.org+1
          Response body (383 bytes) 
          <title>HTTP Parameter Pollution Example</title>

<a href="?pp=12">check</a><br/>
<a href="params.php?p=valid&pp=12">link1</a><br/><a href="params.php?p=valid&pp=12">link2</a><br/><form action="params.php?p=valid&pp=12"><input type=submit name=aaaa/></form><br/>
<hr>
<a href='http://blog.mindedsecurity.com/2009/05/client-side-http-parameter-pollution.html'>Original article</a>
          Evidence 
          X-Powered-By: PHP/5.6.40-38+ubuntu20.04.1+deb.sury.org+1
          Solution

          Ensure that your web server, application server, load balancer, etc. is configured to suppress "X-Powered-By" headers.
        13. GET http://testphp.vulnweb.com/hpp/params.php?p=valid&pp=12
          Alert tags
          • OWASP_2021_A01
          • WSTG-v42-INFO-08
          • OWASP_2017_A03
          Alert description

          The web/application server is leaking information via one or more "X-Powered-By" HTTP response headers. Access to such information may facilitate attackers identifying other frameworks/components your web application is reliant upon and the vulnerabilities such components may be subject to.
          Request
          Request line and header section (282 bytes) 
          GET http://testphp.vulnweb.com/hpp/params.php?p=valid&pp=12 HTTP/1.1
Host: testphp.vulnweb.com
User-Agent: Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 10.0; Win64; x64; rv:92.0) Gecko/20100101 Firefox/92.0
Pragma: no-cache
Cache-Control: no-cache
Referer: http://testphp.vulnweb.com/hpp/?pp=12
          Request body (0 bytes)
          Response
          Status line and header section (200 bytes) 
          HTTP/1.1 200 OK
Server: nginx/1.19.0
Date: Mon, 25 Jul 2022 13:37:48 GMT
Content-Type: text/html; charset=UTF-8
Connection: keep-alive
X-Powered-By: PHP/5.6.40-38+ubuntu20.04.1+deb.sury.org+1
          Response body (7 bytes) 
          valid12
          Evidence 
          X-Powered-By: PHP/5.6.40-38+ubuntu20.04.1+deb.sury.org+1
          Solution

          Ensure that your web server, application server, load balancer, etc. is configured to suppress "X-Powered-By" headers.
        14. GET http://testphp.vulnweb.com/index.php
          Alert tags
          • OWASP_2021_A01
          • WSTG-v42-INFO-08
          • OWASP_2017_A03
          Alert description

          The web/application server is leaking information via one or more "X-Powered-By" HTTP response headers. Access to such information may facilitate attackers identifying other frameworks/components your web application is reliant upon and the vulnerabilities such components may be subject to.
          Request
          Request line and header section (252 bytes) 
          GET http://testphp.vulnweb.com/index.php HTTP/1.1
Host: testphp.vulnweb.com
User-Agent: Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 10.0; Win64; x64; rv:92.0) Gecko/20100101 Firefox/92.0
Pragma: no-cache
Cache-Control: no-cache
Referer: http://testphp.vulnweb.com
          Request body (0 bytes)
          Response
          Status line and header section (200 bytes) 
          HTTP/1.1 200 OK
Server: nginx/1.19.0
Date: Mon, 25 Jul 2022 13:37:41 GMT
Content-Type: text/html; charset=UTF-8
Connection: keep-alive
X-Powered-By: PHP/5.6.40-38+ubuntu20.04.1+deb.sury.org+1
          Response body (4958 bytes)

<div id="siteInfo">  <a href="http://www.acunetix.com">About Us</a> | <a href="privacy.php">Privacy Policy</a> | <a href="mailto:wvs@acunetix.com">Contact Us</a> | <a href="/Mod_Rewrite_Shop/">Shop</a> | <a href="/hpp/">HTTP Parameter Pollution</a> | &copy;2019
  Acunetix Ltd 
</div> 
    
    
<br> 
<div style="background-color:lightgray;width:100%;text-align:center;font-size:12px;padding:1px">
<p style="padding-left:5%;padding-right:5%"><b>Warning</b>: This is not a real shop. This is an example PHP application, which is intentionally vulnerable to web attacks. It is intended to help you test Acunetix. It also helps you understand how developer errors and bad configuration may let someone break into your website. You can use it to test other tools and your manual hacking skills as well. Tip: Look for potential SQL Injections, Cross-site Scripting (XSS), and Cross-site Request Forgery (CSRF), and more.</p>
</div>
</div>
</body>
<!-- InstanceEnd --></html>
          Evidence 
          X-Powered-By: PHP/5.6.40-38+ubuntu20.04.1+deb.sury.org+1
          Solution

          Ensure that your web server, application server, load balancer, etc. is configured to suppress "X-Powered-By" headers.
        15. GET http://testphp.vulnweb.com/listproducts.php?artist=1
          Alert tags
          • OWASP_2021_A01
          • WSTG-v42-INFO-08
          • OWASP_2017_A03
          Alert description

          The web/application server is leaking information via one or more "X-Powered-By" HTTP response headers. Access to such information may facilitate attackers identifying other frameworks/components your web application is reliant upon and the vulnerabilities such components may be subject to.
          Request
          Request line and header section (289 bytes) 
          GET http://testphp.vulnweb.com/listproducts.php?artist=1 HTTP/1.1
Host: testphp.vulnweb.com
User-Agent: Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 10.0; Win64; x64; rv:92.0) Gecko/20100101 Firefox/92.0
Pragma: no-cache
Cache-Control: no-cache
Referer: http://testphp.vulnweb.com/artists.php?artist=1
          Request body (0 bytes)
          Response
          Status line and header section (200 bytes) 
          HTTP/1.1 200 OK
Server: nginx/1.19.0
Date: Mon, 25 Jul 2022 13:37:47 GMT
Content-Type: text/html; charset=UTF-8
Connection: keep-alive
X-Powered-By: PHP/5.6.40-38+ubuntu20.04.1+deb.sury.org+1
          Response body (7994 bytes) 
          <!DOCTYPE HTML PUBLIC "-//W3C//DTD HTML 4.01 Transitional//EN"
"http://www.w3.org/TR/html4/loose.dtd">
<html><!-- InstanceBegin template="/Templates/main_dynamic_template.dwt.php" codeOutsideHTMLIsLocked="false" -->
<head>
<meta http-equiv="Content-Type" content="text/html; charset=iso-8859-2">

<!-- InstanceBeginEditable name="document_title_rgn" -->
<title>pictures</title>
<!-- InstanceEndEditable -->
<link rel="stylesheet" href="style.css" type="text/css">
<!-- InstanceBeginEditable name="headers_rgn" -->
<!-- InstanceEndEditable -->
<script language="JavaScript" type="text/JavaScript">
<!--
function MM_reloadPage(init) {  //reloads the window if Nav4 resized
  if (init==true) with (navigator) {if ((appName=="Netscape")&&(parseInt(appVersion)==4)) {
    document.MM_pgW=innerWidth; document.MM_pgH=innerHeight; onresize=MM_reloadPage; }}
  else if (innerWidth!=document.MM_pgW || innerHeight!=document.MM_pgH) location.reload();
}

//-->
</script>
